Donald Rumsfeld also has several complaints about message. He contends it was a mistake for the administration, after finding no WMDs in Iraq, to shift to speaking more about implanting democracy as a rationale for the war. Condoleezza Rice seemed to be the one top advisor who spoke that way, he writes,`` but it was not clear to me whether she was encouraging the President to use rhetoric about democracy or whether it was originating with the President.'' The La Mesa Republican Monday said his Senate Bill Lockyer 120 would force the state to accept registered warrants as payment for taxes or fees. IOUs could be a death knell for already struggling California businesses, Joel Anderson said in a statement. I think the world's a better place with[ former Iraqi president] Saddam Hussein gone and with the Taliban gone and the al-Qaeda out of Afghanistan, he said, adding that the President Bush administration's decision to invade Iraq in the wake of the Sept. 11 attacks on the US was`` incremental,'' not rushed.
